name: zod_email_regex_pattern
prompt: What is the exact regex pattern string used by Zod for z.string().email() validation?

groundTruth.validationQuery: Zod's email regex is: /^(?!\.)(?!.*\.\.)([A-Z0-9_+-.]*)[A-Z0-9_+-]@([A-Z0-9][A-Z0-9-]*\.)+[A-Z]{2,}$/i. Must contain this pattern or describe it accurately.

name: drizzle_is_placeholder
prompt: What is the exact property name Drizzle ORM uses to identify SQL placeholders (the symbol key)?

groundTruth.validationQuery: Drizzle uses Symbol.for('drizzle:IsDrizzleReader') or similar pattern with 'IsDrizzleReader' to identify placeholders.

name: effect_fiber_status
description: Exact fiber status values in Effect-TS
prompt: What are the exact string values for FiberStatus in Effect-TS (the _tag values)?

groundTruth.validationQuery: Effect-TS FiberStatus has exactly 3 states: 'Done', 'Running', 'Suspended'. Must list all 3.

name: ohash_native_function_suffix
description: Exact suffix for native function detection in ohash
prompt: What exact string suffix does the ohash library check for (using slice) to detect native JavaScript functions during serialization?

groundTruth.validationQuery: ohash checks if Function.prototype.toString() ends with '[native code] }' (15 characters, note the space before closing brace). The code uses fnStr.slice(-15) === '[native code] }'.

name: citty_nan_check_expression
description: Exact NaN check expression in citty parser
prompt: What exact JavaScript expression does citty's internal _parser.ts toVal function use to check if a parsed CLI argument value is a valid number (not NaN)?

groundTruth.validationQuery: citty uses the expression 'x * 0 === 0' to check for valid numbers. This works because NaN * 0 === NaN (not 0), while any valid number * 0 === 0.

name: unstorage_fs_default_ignore
description: Default ignore patterns in unstorage fs driver
prompt: What are the exact default ignore patterns (glob strings) used by unstorage's fs driver when no custom ignore option is provided? List all of them.

groundTruth.validationQuery: unstorage's fs driver uses exactly two default ignore patterns: '**/node_modules/**' and '**/.git/**'. Both patterns must be present.

name: defu_module_tostring_check
description: ES Module detection string in defu isPlainObject
prompt: In the defu library's isPlainObject function, what exact string does it compare Object.prototype.toString.call(value) against when Symbol.toStringTag is present to determine if the object should be treated as a plain object (ES Module)?

groundTruth.validationQuery: defu's isPlainObject returns true for objects with Symbol.toStringTag only when Object.prototype.toString.call(value) === '[object Module]'. This allows ES Modules to be treated as plain objects for merging.

name: h3_chunked_cookie_prefix
description: Exact prefix for chunked cookies in h3
prompt: What is the exact prefix string that the h3 framework prepends to cookie names when splitting large cookies into chunks?

groundTruth.validationQuery: h3 uses '__chunked__' as the CHUNKED_COOKIE constant prefix when splitting large cookies. The full pattern is `${name}${CHUNKED_COOKIE}${index}`.

name: scule_str_splitters
description: Default string splitter characters in scule
prompt: What are the exact 4 characters in the STR_SPLITTERS array that the scule library uses by default to split strings for case conversion?

groundTruth.validationQuery: scule's STR_SPLITTERS constant is exactly ['-', '_', '/', '.']. These 4 characters are used to split strings before case transformation.

name: consola_silent_log_level
description: Numeric value for silent log level in consola
prompt: What exact numeric value does the consola library use for the 'silent' log level in its LogLevels object?

groundTruth.validationQuery: consola sets LogLevels.silent = Number.NEGATIVE_INFINITY. This ensures silent level is always lower than any other log level.

name: hookable_callback_suffix
description: Auto-generated hook callback name suffix in hookable
prompt: What exact suffix string does the hookable library append to auto-generated hook callback function names (the part after the sanitized hook name)?

groundTruth.validationQuery: hookable generates callback names using the pattern: '_' + name.replace(/\W+/g, '_') + '_hook_cb'. The suffix is always '_hook_cb'.
